name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione has a melting point around 106°C. The basic unit for this compound is piperazine which has a melting point around 106°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups generally increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C each. However, 1-ethyl substitution tends to lower the melting point compared to piperazine, as it creates a more asymmetric structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. Summing up these changes: Piperazine base (+106°C), two carbonyl groups (+20°C), and one ethyl group (-10°C).
